definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

sentences.english: Used for wrinkle-removing of all kinds of leather material. With art speed-regulating DC motor, it is easy for operation.
sentences.chinese: 对各种皮料折皱之用，使用调速直流电机，操作方便。

sentences.english: Creases are what I want. But now you flatten it.
sentences.chinese: 我要的就是折皱，但你现在却把它熨平了。

sentences.english: This was evident from the perpendicular wrinkles.
sentences.chinese: 这可以从那些垂直的折皱上看出来。

sentences.english: The parchment crinkled crisply as he slid it toward the paymaster.
sentences.chinese: 当他把羊皮纸递给会计的时候它们清脆的折皱。

sentences.english: Oh, what is that crumpled thing over there?
sentences.chinese: 咦，那边那个折折皱皱的东西是什么？

definition: variant of 皺褶|皱褶[zhou4 zhe3]
welt seam (doubled over and sewed again from topside)
to flatten out (paper, film, metal plates etc)
